# Stable Isotopes 101

> ## .blue[Many elements have isotopes with varying neutrons]

> ## .blue[eg, <sup>12</sup>C <sup>13</sup>C <sup>14</sup>C]

> ## .blue[Those than are _not_ radioactive are "stable" (<sup>12</sup>C <sup>13</sup>C)]


---

# Stable Isotopes 101

> ## .blue[Lighter isotopes are favored in cellular processes]

> ## .blue[This leads to measurable "fractionation"]


---

# Stable Isotopes 101

> ## .blue[Carbon isotopes tell us about energy source]

> ## .blue[eg, rice or wheat (C3) vs corn (C4)]


---

# Stable Isotopes 101

> ## .blue[Carbon isotopes tell us about energy source]

> ## .blue[eg, rice or wheat (C3) vs corn (C4)]

> ## .green[Nitrogen isotopes tell us about trophic level]

> ## .green[ie, consumers accumulate heavier isotope]
